snippet: The Obama administration, adhering to a Supreme Court ruling, issued a policy that allows for-profit companies to avoid providing insurance coverage for birth control.
abstract: New rules issued by Obama administration in Affordable Care Act allow exemption for family-owned corporations that object to birth control on religious grounds, compliance with 2014 Supreme Court ruling; administration says that birth control will still be available to women enrolled in plans, but will be paid for separately by insurers.
lead_paragraph: The Obama administration, adhering to a Supreme Court ruling, issued a policy that allows for-profit companies to avoid providing insurance coverage for birth control.

headline.main: Health Law’s Contraceptive Rule Eased for Businesses With Religious Objections
headline.print_headline: New Health Care Rules Are Issued for Companies Claiming Religious Exemptions

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
